intro: Blepharis verticillata, commonly known as the wheelleaf blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Blepharis verticillata is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
